info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 26 at 8:40PM EDT until August 26 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Catawba County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... West central Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 930 PM EDT. * At 840 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 5 miles north of Newton, or near Conover, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Newton, Conover, Claremont, Catawba, Lake Norman State Park, Lookout Shoals Lake, Sherrills Ford, Bandys, Terrell and Oxford. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
